edges.desc: Boggs eumorphic projection averages the y-coordinates of Sinusoidal projection and Mollweide projection.
Mollweide projection, Wagner 4 projection, Eckert 3 projection, Eckert 4 projection and Hatano Asymmetric projection have elliptical forms of meridians.
Wagner 1, Wagner 2 and Wagner 3 have the same shape.
Putniņš P4' and Wagner 1 have similar shape.
Tobler hyperelliptical projection degenerates to Mollweide projection when α = 0, k = 2, and γ ≈ 1.2731.
Putniņš P3' and Wagner 1 have similar shape.
Trans. Cylindrical is a transverse form of Lambert cylindrical projection.
Eckert 3, Eckert 4 and Ortelius Oval have the same shape.
Goode homolosire projection is a blending of Sinusoidal projection (less than 40°44′11.8″N/S) and Mollweide projection (in elsewhere).
Hammer projection, Aitoff projection, Mollweide projection, Apian II projection and Raisz Half-ellipsoidal (untilted) projection have a shape of 2:1 ellipse.
Putniņš P4' and Wagner 2 have similar shape.
Goode homolosire projection is a blending of Sinusoidal projection (less than 40°44′11.8″N/S) and Mollweide projection (in elsewhere).
Foucaut Sinusoidal is a blending of Sinusoidal and Lambert cylindrical.
Wagner 1, Wagner 2 and Wagner 3 have the same shape.
Hammer projection, Aitoff projection, Mollweide projection, Apian II projection and Raisz Half-ellipsoidal (untilted) projection have a shape of 2:1 ellipse.
standard parallel and aspect ratio of Gall-Peters projection is 45° and π/2, while 0° and π for Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection
Sinusoidal projection is a special case of Bonne projection where its standard parallel is 0°, while standard parallel of Bonne projection is arbitrary (typically is 45°N).
Foucaut Sinusoidal is a blending of Sinusoidal and Lambert cylindrical.
Putniņš P3' projection and Putniņš P4' projection have the same shape.
Wagner IV projection, Wagner V projection, Wagner VI projection and Winkel III BOPC projection have the same shape.
Mayr is a blending of Sinusoidal and Lambert cylindrical.
Mollweide projection, Wagner 4 projection, Eckert 3 projection, Eckert 4 projection and Hatano Asymmetric projection have elliptical forms of meridians.

Eckert V projection is similar to Winkel I projection where it uses Plate Carrée projection (standard parallels at equator), Winkel I projection uses Equirectangular projection with standard parallels at 50°28′N/S.
standard parallel and aspect ratio of Balthasart projection is 50° and c.a. 1.30, while 0° and π for Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection
Hammer projection, Aitoff projection, Mollweide projection, Apian II projection and Raisz Half-ellipsoidal (untilted) projection have a shape of 2:1 ellipse.
Meridians of Sinusoidal projection, McBryde–Thomas flat-pole sinusoidal projection, Eckert V projection, Eckert VI projection and Winkel I projection are sinusoids.
Putniņš P1 projection and Putniņš P2 projection have the same shape.
standard parallel and aspect ratio of Hobo-Dyer projection is 37.5° and c.a. 1.98, while 0° and π for Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection
Putniņš P3' and Wagner 2 have similar shape.
Goode homolosire projection and Boggs eumorphic projection have interruptted forms in typical case.
Meridians of McBryde–Thomas flat-pole parabolic projection and Putniņš P4 projection are parabolas.
Putniņš P5' and Putniņš P6' have the same shape.
Boggs eumorphic and Siemon IV have similar shape.
Mollweide projection, Wagner 4 projection, Eckert 3 projection, Eckert 4 projection and Hatano Asymmetric projection have elliptical forms of meridians.
Eckert 3, Eckert 4 and Ortelius Oval have the same shape.
Boggs eumorphic and Putniņš P1 have similar shape.
Wagner 1, Wagner 2 and Wagner 3 have the same shape.
Wagner IV projection, Wagner V projection, Wagner VI projection and Winkel III BOPC projection have the same shape.
Boggs eumorphic projection averages the y-coordinates of Sinusoidal projection and Mollweide projection.
standard parallel and aspect ratio of Tobler projection is 55.65° and c.a. 1, while 0° and π for Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection
Meridians of Sinusoidal projection, McBryde–Thomas flat-pole sinusoidal projection, Eckert V projection, Eckert VI projection and Winkel I projection are sinusoids.
Cassini projection is the transverse form of Plate carrée projection.
Atlantis projection is a oblique version of Mollweide projection.
standard parallel and aspect ratio of Triston Edwards projection is 37.4° and c.a. 1.98, while 0° and π for Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection
Putniņš P3' and Wagner 3 have similar shape.
Tobler hyperelliptical projection degenerates to Collignon projection when α = 0 and k = 1.
Werner projection is a special case of Bonne projection where its standard parallel is 90°N, while standard parallel of Bonne projection is arbitrary (typically is 45°N).
Meridians of McBryde–Thomas flat-pole quartic projection and Quartic authalic projection are fourth-order curves.
Wagner IV projection, Wagner V projection, Wagner VI projection and Winkel III BOPC projection have the same shape.
Siemon IV and Putniņš P2 have similar shape.
Hammer projection, Aitoff projection, Mollweide projection, Apian II projection and Raisz Half-ellipsoidal (untilted) projection have a shape of 2:1 ellipse.
standard parallel and aspect ratio of Behrmann projection is 30° and c.a. 2.36, while 0° and π for Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection
Plate Carrée projection is a special case of Equirectangular projection which uses equator as standard parallel.
Wagner IV projection, Wagner V projection, Wagner VI projection and Winkel III BOPC projection have the same shape.
Wagner IV projection, Wagner V projection, Wagner VI projection and Winkel III BOPC projection have the same shape.
Wagner VI projection is equivalent to Kavrayskiy VII projection vertically compressed by a factor of √3/2.
Mayr is a blending of Sinusoidal and Lambert cylindrical.
Briesemeister projection is a oblique and rescaled version of Hammer projection.
Eckert 1 and Eckert 2 have the same shape.
Bottomley projection is a special case of Bonne projection where its standard parallel is 30°N, while standard parallel of Bonne projection is arbitrary (typically is 45°N).
Boggs eumorphic and Putniņš P2 have similar shape.
Putniņš P5 projection and Putniņš P6 projection have the same shape.
Eckert 3, Eckert 4 and Ortelius Oval have the same shape.
Eckert 5 and Eckert 6 have the same shape.
Apian Globular I and Bacon Globular have the same shape.
Putniņš P4' and Wagner 3 have similar shape.
Gauss–Krüger projection is a transverse form of Mercator projection.
Mollweide projection, Wagner 4 projection, Eckert 3 projection, Eckert 4 projection and Hatano Asymmetric projection have elliptical forms of meridians.
Wagner IV projection, Wagner V projection, Wagner VI projection and Winkel III BOPC projection have the same shape.
Putniņš P3 and Craster's parabolic have the same shape.
Siemon IV and Putniņš P1 have similar shape.
Equal Earth is inspired by Robinson projection.
Wagner VII projection and Wagner VIII projection have the same shape.
standard parallel and aspect ratio of Smyth projection is 37.07° and 2, while 0° and π for Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection
Jenny 2018 is a blending of Azimuthal equal-area and Trans. Cylindrical.
Putniņš P3' projection is a blending of Plate Carrée projection and Putniņš P3 projection.
Winkel II projection uses arithmetic mean of Equirectangular projection and Mollweide projection.
Azimuthal equal-area is employed in the construction of White 1992.
McBryde P3 is a fusion of McBT FPP and Craster's parabolic.

Winkel I projection uses arithmetic mean of Sinusoidal projection and Equirectangular projection with standard parallels at 50°28′N/S.
Meridians of Sinusoidal projection, McBryde–Thomas flat-pole sinusoidal projection, Eckert V projection, Eckert VI projection and Winkel I projection are sinusoids.
Kavrayskyi I projection combines Mercator projection and Equirectangular projection.
Azimuthal equal-area is employed in the construction of SAND 2000.
Winkel II projection uses arithmetic mean of Equirectangular projection and Apian II projection.
Arden-Close projection is a blending of Mercator projection and Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection.
McBryde Q3 is a fusion of McBT FPQ and Quartic authalic.
Winkel I projection uses arithmetic mean of Sinusoidal projection and Equirectangular projection with standard parallels at 50°28′N/S.
Azimuthal equal-area is employed in the construction of SEA.
Strebe 2018 is a blending of Azimuthal equal-area projection and Albers equal-area conic projection.
Wagner 6 (Putniņš P1') projection is a blending of Plate Carrée projection and Putniņš P1 projection.
Strebe 2016 is a blending of Bonne projection and Albers equal-area conic projection.
Eckert V projection combines Sinusoidal projection and Plate Carrée projection.
Strebe 2018 is a blending of Azimuthal equal-area projection and Albers equal-area conic projection.
McBryde S3 is a fusion of Sinusoidal and McBT FPS.
HEALPix is hybrid of Collignon projection and Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection.
McBryde S3 is a fusion of Sinusoidal and McBT FPS.
Breusing projection uses a geometric means of the radii of Stereographic projection and Azimuthal equal-area projection.
Winkel tripel projection uses arithmetic mean of Aitoff projection and Equirectangular projection with standard parallels at 50°28′N/S.
Strebe 1995 is constructed by using Eckert IV projection, Mollweide projection and Hammer-Aitoff projection.
Wagner 6 (Putniņš P1') projection is a blending of Plate Carrée projection and Putniņš P1 projection.
McBryde P3 is a fusion of McBT FPP and Craster's parabolic.
Azimuthal equal-area is employed in the construction of NUG 2010.
Arden-Close projection is a blending of Mercator projection and Lambert cylindrical equal-area projection.
Azimuthal equal-area is employed in the construction of USG 2011.
Winkel II projection uses arithmetic mean of Equirectangular projection and Apian II projection.
Strebe 1995 is constructed by using Eckert IV projection, Mollweide projection and Hammer-Aitoff projection.
McBryde Q3 is a fusion of McBT FPQ and Quartic authalic.

Eckert V projection combines Sinusoidal projection and Plate Carrée projection.

McBryde S2 is a fusion of Sinusoidal and Eckert 6.

McBryde S2 is a fusion of Sinusoidal and Eckert 6.
Aitoff projection is constructed based on the equatorial form of azimuthal equidistant projection
